wikipedia_page.main: Richard Pryce (14 May 1864 – 30 May 1942) was an English novelist, author of Christopher, David Penstephen and other works of fiction. He was also a playwright and wrote a number of one act and three-act plays. Disappointed with his cold reception by the public in Britain, despite glowing reviews, he wrote very little after the outbreak of the First World War.

response: 'Op o' Me Thumb is a 1904 one-act play by the English authors Frederick Fenn and Richard Pryce. It was produced at the Court Theatre, London, on 13 March 1904, in a double bill with Robert Browning's A Soul's Tragedy. It transferred to the St James's Theatre on 24 April 1904. The leading role of Amanda was played by Hilda Trevelyan.Gaye, p. 1451 The play was staged in New York in 1905 with Maude Adams as Amanda."At the Play", The Observer, 19 February 1905, p. 6 It was filmed in 1920 as Suds, starring Mary Pickford in the role created by Trevelyan.
